results.title: Voici le Temps des Assassins = a Time for Murder
results.creator_credit: Charles Borderie, Robert Bossis and Julien Duvivier
results.brief_description:
Andre Chatelain is a quiet, middle-aged restaurant owner in Les Halles district of Paris. His life becomes unexpectedly complicated when Catherine pays a visit. She introduces herself as the daughther of his late ex-wife. Moved by the distress of Catherine, Andre invites her to stay with him. Soon after, Gerard, Andre’s adopted son, is smitten by the young woman. But she makes it clear she is only interested in Andre. Andre, however, suspects the young woman to be a liar and possibly a psychotic, mixed up with a number of underworld types. This film offers a very realistic depiction of the life and activities of Les Halles at the time it was considered as the ‘belly of Paris’. The title song is interpreted by Germaine Montero.

Credits: Producers, Charles Borderie, Robert Bossis ; director, Julien Duvivier ; writers, Julien Duvivier, Maurice Bessy, Charles Dorat ; photography, Armand Thirard ; music, Jean Wiener.
Cast: Jean Gabin, Daniele Delorme, Grerad Blain, Germaine Kerjean, Lucienne Bogaert, Robert Arnoux, Jean-Paul Roussillon, Robert Manuel.

results.title: Voices on the Page: David Williamson (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton and Ian Walker
results.brief_description: The “Compulsive Playwright” provides you with a unique insight into the man and his work. His early experience, the problems of writing for film (Gallipoli), lecturing to students on the writing process, and rehearsing with actors, are all part of this entertaining and informative video. This package has been designed for students of literature everywhere. It has a particular application for students studying senior English at Years 11 and 12 and tertiary institutions. Study guide included.

results.title: Voices of Malaya
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information, Colonial Office, Ralth Eaton and Terry Trench
results.brief_description: Voices of Malaya was made before hostilities in Malaya began, in the period immediately after World War 2. It is primarily a background study of the problems facing a country with a population of five million people - Malayan, Chinese-Malayan, Indian-Malayan and European - who are suffering from the aftermath of war. It shows the efforts of the mixed nationalities of Malaya working and living together in the best interests of their country. Music by Elizabeth Lutyens, played by The Philharmonic Orchestra and conducted by John Hollingsworth.

results.title: Voices from a war (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: Australian War Memorial, Interactive Multimedia and Ryebuck Media
results.brief_description: This CD-ROM and guide contains screens of photos, paintings, objects, letters, diaries and original archival material from the Australian War Memorial. In particular it looks at the Siege of Tobruk, The Battle for Papua, and The Sandakan-Ranau Death Marches. An education guide accompanies this CD-ROM with useful study topics and resource material. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Colour capable Macintosh, or MPC2 standard PC with 8 mb available RAM, double speed CD ROM drive and hard disk. QuickTime 2.5 for Macintosh or QuickTime 2.1 for Windows (supplied).

results.title: Voices and visions from Indonesia (MAC & PC)
results.brief_description: SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Windows Media Player (Windows) or Quick Time Version 3 or above (Mac) installed. The movie file (MPEG) format must be checked in the players Tools>Options>Formats menu. Minimum system requirements: PC: Pentium 266, Windows 95/98, Windows Media Player Version 6.0, 32 MB RAM, 800 x 600 SVGA display set to 16-bit (thousands) colour, 4 x CD-ROM card, sound card. Macintosh: Power Macintosh, OS 8.5, Quick Time Version 3.0, 32 MB RAM, 800 x 600 monitor set to thousands of colours, 4 x CD-ROM drive, sound card. Presented in four sections - literature, popular publishing, film and television, visual and performing arts - this CD ROM presents images, excerpts and movie clips from Indonesia to provide a rich array of cultural information. Information can be printed, sociological, geographical and historical context accessed, and teacher guides for suggested classroom activity for years 10-12 utilised. The CD also provides a general overview of Indonesia, a map of the region, searchable interface as well as a glossary. Funded by the Commonwealth Department of Education, Training and Youth Affairs under the National Asian Languages and Studies in Australian Schools (NALSAS) Strategy.

results.title: Voice of the inland
results.brief_description: Shows aspects of the work of the Royal Flying Doctor Service, including the giving of a diagnosis and method of treatment over the radio and a typical journey of the flying doctor. Also illustrates activities of the School of the Air.

results.title: Voice of the fugitive
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Maxine Samuels, Roman Kroitor and Rene Bonniere
results.brief_description: In the 1850s, Canada meant freedom for many escaped slaves, but the route known as the “underground railroad” was a dangerous one at the best of times. This drama tells the story of one group travelling the perilous route. It tells, too, of the people who could be trusted to help, and of the trackers and their dogs, who could cut off the lifeline to the border suddenly and very cruelly.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Maxine Samuels, Roman Kroitor and Rene Bonniere

results.title: Voice of the forest
results.creator_credit: United States. Forest Service and U.S.A Department of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Presented by the 14 Eastern States in co-operation with the United States Department of Agriculture, this film tells a story about a boy at a summer camp who, bored with camp routine, adventures into the forest, talks with the birds and animals, gets lost in the woods, sees the destructiveness of a forest fire, and returns to camp with a better understanding and appreciation of forests and forestry. However, the basic message of the film would appear to be that if we look after our forests, they will serve us better, ie the manufacture of plastics and chemicals etc rather than saving forests and preserving the ecology.

results.title: Voice of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a lively account of the many-sided contribution of engineers, planners, producers, actors, musicians and technicians to the pleasure of Canada’s radio listeners. Excerpts from popular programs like Stage ‘47, The Happy Gang, Prairie Schooner, and The Trio Lyrique are heard. The film ends with an indication of the activities of the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation’s International Service.
